reviewText: I purchased Breathless Body:1 and loved it so much that I just had to get Breathless Body: 2 The Edge.  I love it too!  These are challenging tabatta /HIIT workouts, and they have really made a big difference in my body composition.  It doesn't hurt that my husband has noticed and has commented favorably :)  Amy Dixon is a wonderful leader, cues well, and will leave you breathless by the time you ars finished working out.  She is my new favorite workout instructor.  I recently ordered Breathless Body: 3 and highly recommend it too!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Amy Dixon is a maestro of getting you to your cardiovascular edge and keeping you there. This is a well balanced workout with clear cueing and demonstration of 3 levels (beginner, intermediate and advanced). Amy and her team very clearly explain and demonstrate each move.You find your own level and this is a plus because it means that essentially anyone can do this workout.The studio where they work is bright and easy to look at.Amy is encouraging all the way through and it is gratifying to to see her and her team sweating right along with you.the exercises are mainly cardio, no major strength training here, and that is why I dropped a star. Would have been good to do some toning as well, but I guess you can't have it all!would definitely recommend this product
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am SO glad that I pre-ordered this back in April, since it is now sold out! For those finding this DVD for the first time, please look at Breathless Body , as this workout is MORE intense then the first one Amy released. Having said that, it is extremely challenging and an effective workout that will have advanced exercisers "breathless."In this workout she does 4 sets of 3 drills (12 total instead of 8 total as in the first one), each 30 seconds instead of 20 (as in the first one), with a recovery of 15 seconds instead of 10 (as in the first one). All 4 sets are completed around the 40 minute mark, but then the EDGE happens - this is when Amy has you do all 12 DRILLS, with NO BREAK. It will challenge your body to get through all 12 drills, for a super last ditch "high-intensity" calorie burn! In 48 minutes (the length of the actual workout part), I burned over 400 calories! The cool down is very good, given that this workout has a lot of plyometrics (plank jacks, X lunges, russian squats, etc.). Total workout time, including the cool down, is about 53 minutes. I will be using this, Breathless Body 1 and Ultimate Tae Boe to supplement my 3 days of weight training - excellent DVD!
summary: Extremely CHALLENGING - Another GREAT Amy workout!

reviewText: There is nothing wrong with this workout, but it is just not for me. I have the original Breathelss Body and like its Tabata-style cardio format. I like pushing myself for those 20 seconds, knowing that I will get a short break after it. I also like that once we have done the Tabata cycles of a particular exercise - we are done! Unfortunately, Breathless 2's format is different - and I thought the difference in the two workouts would be interesting - but it was not the case for me. I found doing three different exercises in a cycle to be tedious and I was rather annoyed at how many times I had to get dowm on my hands to do some cardio version of a plank. At the end, when we have to repeat all of the exercises, it is just tedious! I quit - not because I was tired - but because I was so bored. My heart rate was high - I am sure I burned calories, but do not want to repeat this workout. If you like solid cardio and do not need variety - this is a fine workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a huge fan of Breathless Body Volume 1. I perform that workout on a weekly basis and love the way it conditions my body, builds my endurance, and cultivates mental discipline. I would have been happy if Breathless Body 2: The Edge used the same tabata format with different exercises however instead the set up is significantly different and I think this makes the time fly by even faster. You perform 4 major sets that each have 3 exercises that you perform for 30 seconds each and then a quick break and you go through that three times per set. The final section, after set 4, you go through all 12 exercises for 30 seconds with no rest. The time flies by and I found the 4 sets to be challenging at an intermediate level (I bounced back and forth between level one and level 2, mainly level 2) and then the final set where you go through all 12 exercises is totally killer. I cramped up and had to go at a slower pace towards the end - obviously I'll have to really build up some more endurance or make sure that I hydrated better prior to the workout. I feel like all 12 exercises hit your muscles well and that you get more of a strength building element in this than Breathless Body 1 which was perhaps more focused on pure cardio. Expect to see a lot of plyometrics with some plank variations and more of a focus on strengthening core and hips. Performing some of the exercises at level 3 gives you the option to work in some push up's. As always, Amy is very inspirational, has a good presence and she keeps it REAL because you can see the sweat and effort exerted with her and her models and you see them go through their own struggles and endurance issues. Love this video and will make it part of my regular weekly rotation. Would love to see a Volume 3 in the future!
summary: Breathless keeps getting better and better!

reviewText: I love Amy Dixon workouts and this continued that trend. This is a great cardio workout and with the fast pace and mixture of exercises you never have time to get bored. Even though this is a cardio workout without any weights you still get a great leg workout as well as good core training while doing the exercises.

reviewText: Breathless Body 2 is a great addition to your workout dvd lineup.  I have found so many dvds incorporate weight lifting that it has become hard to actually get a true cardio endurance workout.The dvd is similar to her tabata style workout in the first "Breathless" dvd.  She teaches you each skill level ( 3 in all) and allows you to choose.  Then you need to continue to repeat the move for a short limited time.  The whole workout is repeated at the end in a "speed round".  All the moves are simple moves, but repetition makes your muscles work.  Amy Dixon keeps you interested and well cued with her conversation and motivating talk.  The whole dvd lasts almost an hour ... which is unusual, most seem to be 30 min ... I love that it lasts almost an hour.... I usually have to piece 2 dvds together to meet up to a health club workout.My style:  I personally love Amy Dixon.  I own her 2 dvds from Women's Health and her first Breathless ... and love to use them regularly.  I also own the "Jackie" dvds as a great weight lifting supplement.  I do not like the early Jillian dvds (so have not tried other ones) or the tae bo dvds.  I enjoy to work out hard & sweat "hard".  I like to work out 5 days a week/1 hour a day.  I like the P90X series, too.  I am currently exploring Tracy Anderson.

reviewText: The first Breathless body is better in my opinion, and there are less people in it. In the first one Amy Dixon only has three people on video, including herself. Low impact, medium intensity, and high intensity. In Breathless Body 2 there are four people including herself. Low impact, 2 medium intensity, and high intensity. I prefer the set up with Breathless Body 1, but the workouts are wonderful. I was literally breathless, and had to stop the video once to catch my breath.Breathless Body is a wonderful workout, and this is  a Tabata format of working out which is very effective since all the muscles of the body work, and they work in intervals, the HIIT. Very effective. I would highly recommend to intermediate to advanced fitness levels.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I loved Amy's first tabata style DVD and it's honestly still my favorite. I just like having 3 people instead of 4 and the exercises done 8 times.I also did find one of the ladies distracting because she seemed so tired and almost ill at times. I might feel that way too...but seeing it is different. ; )I feel unless you keep jogging or moving, the explanation for 3 exercises takes too long. That said, once you know them, you can do something to keep your heart rate up a bit. For my achy knees, I found this DVD harder on them than the first, but I do "combine them" in a sense. I will steal some exercises from this DVD to do with the first when I want something fresh or to replace a lunge that I can't do. As long as you go "breathless" any exercise can be replaced after a while. I really love this as an addition once or twice a week when I have time.I can't wait for her next one. Amy is so motivating and I really clicked with her. Sometimes the instructor is so annoying you just can't keep a routine with it. Amy finds the right balance in pushing but also recognizing we are all different and giving you options.

I love the fact the Amy describes the moves in detail - and shows the modifications in detail (easier level and the more challenging level).

reviewText: This is a huge calorie burner & I love, love, love the routine. It is tough but if you need to take it down a notch you can. I've done it at only level 1 in the beginning when that was all i could handle, it challenged me but was very doable. Then I worked up to levels 2-3 intensity. There is always a way to take it up a notch & make it a harder workout if you need it.I still sometimes do level 1 if I want to keep my workout lower impact that day, however today i pushed real hard after not working out for several days (due to an illness). I really wanted to get the most out of my workout & burn some major calories...Boy did I! I am 114lbs and burned over 500 cals according to my Polar HRM. Amy is motivating & pushes you to keep going without being annoying and the video is very straightforward & no nonsense with an upbeat energy. I hope she makes a breathless body III  :)
Title: N/A

reviewText: I completed this workout a day after I tried the original Breathless Body workout from Amy Dixon and my muscles were seriously cussing me for attempting to do such intense hiit workouts on 2 consecutive days, but like a kid with a new toy, I was too eager to wait to try it! I forgot to wear my calorie tracker for the original workout, but monitored my calorie burn for this one and I was just shy of 500 calories. I can usually burn around 600-650 at the most with some of my other workouts in the same duration of time, but I'm not too sad because I accept that in order to burn fat through cardio while preserving as much muscle mass as possible (in order to build a healthy metabolism and as a result burn fat all day not just when working out AND so that once I reach goal weight I have a nice toned figure that didn't lose all it's muscle) I shouldn't rely only on steady state cardio. Research shows that we need to alternate between the moderate intensity "steady state" workouts that burn the 600+ cal. in an hour and this type of cardio workout which is harder interval style with VERY intense for 30 seconds (80% max. heart rate) alternated with 10 seconds of "rest" (it hardly feels like a rest...just chance to catch your breath and give yourself a mental break). I was doing Insanity for my hiit workouts every other day and doing turbo fire or walk/runs as my traditional cardio. I got disgusted with Insanity to be honest...it stressed me out and didn't feel enjoyable. I would always hit a wall with Insanity and inevitably there were strength moves that I had to modify to the point that I wasn't even doing Insanity. Even as I got better at it, I found myself unhappy to push play. It was like taking my medicine and I actually do enjoy exercise normally. THIS workout is a lot like Insanity to me. The moves are quite similar and the intensity is up there too however it's dialed back just enough that I can hang in there (for the most part) and feel like I actually did the dang thing when all is said and done. I would recommend this for a beginner before I would recommend the original...especially if you are someone who refuses to do jumps/plyo due injury, discomfort, weight, etc, etc.  The lowest level instructor keeps her feet on the ground for the most part for all the exercises. You'd just have to really push your arms and legs and speed to get the heart rate up, is all, if you choose lowest level. Also, a beginner COULD even push on to the next higher level, as most of those are not necessarily high impact jumps either. It's just a great mix n match program that you could really grow into over time. The highest level on this is INSANE. He goes faster than I can imagine myself ever going, and he jumps higher than I ever could and he is just amazing to watch as I barely get through the middle level moves. By the time this is all said and done, YOU WILL BE DRIPPING and you will feel like a superhero.
summary: Long Hiit, burned 500 calories in 55 minutes, muscles SORE next day, doable for ANY fitness level

reviewText: I have all of Amy's workouts and I think that the three Breathless Body workouts are so much fun to do and a great challenge. The beauty of these workouts are that you are continually challenging yourself while working out at a pace that is right for you. You can choose to do the easier option, intermediate or advanced option. I love the 6 minute blast at the end. Absolutely brilliant and a great sweatfest. Buy all 3 Breathless Body workouts and rotate them and within a few weeks you'll notice a massive difference in your fitness ability. Highly recommended.
summary: Amy Dixon makes the best workouts

reviewText: I purchased this DVD in November and I gave it a quick look when it first arrived.  I felt that there seemed to be a lot of time between sets with Amy explaining the various exercises.  So, I thought I would not get a good workout.  I am WRONG.  I have been doing my own tabata routine for a few weeks and have workout out with P90X for about 4 years now. I exercise daily so I consider myself a fit person, but there is always room for improvement.  I was thoroughly breathless at the end of the workout.  I have been doing the traditional 20/10 tabata routine for a total of 45 minutes..  I like that just changing the length to a 30/15 split really felt intense.  I was happy to have the extra time to recover while Amy explained the next set of exercises. The exercises are simple yet effective.  I enjoyed this DVD so much, I am getting the other 2 DVDs she has out.  I hope that I will be equally breathless.
Title: N/A

reviewText: let me start by saying I'm overweight by a lot. I quit smoking, threw caution to the wind on my eating habits and now I am fat. 5'3 and over 200 lbs. So..finally sick of being fat and tired I decided to get back in shape. I'll be 45 this year and just don't care to finish life up as a fat chick. I'm sharing this for those who feel this  work out would be out of their league. It's not. I loved the fact there is 3 levels  to chose from. I started at level one and sweated my butt off! There are 3 floor exercises sprinkled through the video which sucked to get up and down from but that's what happens when you have a fat stomach and achy knees. I just went at my own pace which Amy encourages you to do through out the video. I found all the other exercises very do-able. I don't mean easy-but do-able if you are a bigger person or  have knee/back issues. my plan is to do this work out 2-3 times a week  and work towards the other levels. If you are more advanced this work out is still going to kick your butt! I would highly recommend!!
